title: Every day we make choices which have consequences. If there is one choice you could change, which one would it be? - Quora

response.answer_text: It was the year 2013. Class 12th results were out. I had passed with decent marks(more than decent in the eyes of my father). My father had always wanted me to pursue a career in engineering and even though I had asked him again and again during previous two years to allow me to pursue MBBS, his decision never changed. So when he asked me about my plans for future I just stayed silent. I knew what I wanted to do but since that would not be permitted I decided not to say anything. But then I had to tell something. So finally I decided to give in to his decision and pursue engineering. I had taken JEE mains by that time and even though the results were not out, I knew that I was not going to qualify. I told him about that and said that I would be dropping one year for JEE. He agreed. I didn’t have much idea about JEE at that time. And my friends circle was also not a great one either. And I was a shy person at that time. I was hesitant at asking questions and clearing my doubts. So basically I was dropping for JEE without even having proper knowledge about the exam. My father mentioned about coaching which I plainly rejected. Till that time I had never taken coaching in my life and I was of the view that I would clear JEE(at least JEE mains with good marks) by studying on my own. I bought Arihant books for each subject and then started the preparation. I will not me writing much about preparation since I didn’t give it my best and also I never had a feel for engineering. I still remember studying Biology books during that year(just for fun). Even with all this I qualified JEE mains and got admission to NIT srinagar. But later I realised(and now I feel it even more) that I should have gone for coaching. I didn’t even join a test series. I had no idea of a test series at that time. My speed was poor during the exam and so was my accuracy. Had I gone for coaching then I would have joined a much better NIT(maybe an IIT). When I decided to prepare for GATE then I was in a huge dilemma whether to go for coaching or not. I believed that I could do it on my own but that disaster with JEE was still bothering me a lot. In the end I decided to not join coaching(not a great learner, I believe). But this time I did join test series and ended up getting a great rank. I don’t know how much of an impact that decision made on my life but I believe what could have been something great ended at being something good. That’s all folks…

Worrying about survival. We worry about survival and force ourselves to act a certain way, against what we believe at times. I did it too. I always ended up more confused then. We react with fear instead of love if we worry. We end up not being involved in our own lives and hence, not being pro-active enough. I worry, even to this second, but I would like to not worry and I am trying to do so.

Why ask a regret question? Unless we have a time travel machine, the answer it doesn’t matter. The question should be, what have you learn from the choices you made? What will you do differently based on your analysis?
